intro: Orbea mcloughlinii, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Orbea mcloughlinii thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
